basics.name: Jason Raimondi
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: My name is Jason Raimondi and I am a Full Stack Software Engineer. My professional focus has been in web systems; everything from designing to building and deploying server and client web applications. What I really am is a technologist and all around computer geek. Give me a computer and I will be hacking in minutes, occupied for days.

highlights: Automated our release workflow that made tickets very obvious on what environment they were on TODO TODO
Created dynamic review environments for QA and Product Managers to view and approve work for all incoming pull requests.
Redeployed Ruby on Rails application from Opsworks to AWS Elastic Kubernetes Service, resulting 20x node scaling increase by using with horizontal node and vertical pod autoscaling.
Refactored a legacy Capybara test suite into Cypress, including parallelization of tests, speeding up average CI test time from 60+ minutes to ~12 minutes.
Decoupled legacy angular.js (ng1) application from a Rails monolith, moving into an Angular 8+ SPA.

Constructs and manages web applications for clients with varying complexity, from simple static HTML to custom built applications. Depending on client needs, these range from PHP/LEMP stacks to Node.js and Golang applications.

Test drove re-architecture of a legacy PHP 5 code base, decoupling an untested CakePHP 2.x monolith, to a custom PHP 7 API routed through Lumen and an Angular SPA. The project maintained an 85%+ code coverage and was built using Domain Driven Design (DDD) and Command Query Separation (CQS) principles.

Authored middleware client applications built in Golang and Node.js that consumed the Event Farm Rest API. Example applications include a custom event landing page builder, custom event signup flows, and custom event registration pages

Built auto generating client libraries for the Event Farm API. Clients were generated in PHP, Typescript, Golang, Python, Swift and Java, and assisted in the consumption of the Event Farm Rest API. Typescript and Golang libraries were opened sourced and are available on github at ([eventfarm/javascript-sdk](https://github.com/eventfarm/javascript-sdk)) and ([eventfarm/golang-sdk](https://github.com/eventfarm/golang-sdk)) and were used in the official mobile apps as well as the web application.

Headed a custom integration between Salesforce and Event Farm. The integrations would sync the status of Salesforce Leads and Contacts to event attendees and their event status (accepted, declined, checked-in, etc). Open sourced the PHP 7 Salesforce Rest API ([restforcephp](https://github.com/eventfarm/restforcephp)) that we built and used internally for the integrations.
Led team of 4 developers building a SaaS Application for Advertising Agencies to monitor ROI and Reactions to TV Campaigns.
Maintained LEMP stacks on dedicated private servers.

Built and maintained various PHP MVC applications in an assortment of frameworks, from Code Igniter, to Laravel, and FuelPHP. Integrated various web 3rd party services including Google and Twilio into these custom applications.
Redesigned and implemented the update to [WDIV Click on Detroit “Vote 4 the Best”](https://www.clickondetroit.com/vote-4-the-best/) voting application.
Utilized existing web technologies including WordPress, Laravel and Drupal to create small businesses and artist portfolios websites.
Custom video editing, closed captioning, and video motion graphics for clients.
Completed graphic projects while collaborating with clients, designing vector and raster graphics using Illustrator and Photoshop from concept to printed works.
Built custom workstations serving as state of the art graphic editing stations and custom print servers.
Authored a PHP + jQuery + Google Maps based interactive survey's to gather data on Florida's Sarasota Bay & South Carolina's Ace Basin.
Collaborated with two PhD candidates to gather data that was used to research community uses of the Sarasota Bay and the Ace Basin.
Assisted the design and HTML/CSS of a custom built web app for selling student college football tickets built in old-school procedural PHP.

publications.name: typescript-oauth2-server
publications.summary: A standards compliant implementation of an OAuth 2.0 authorization server for Node that utilizes JWT and Proof Key for Code Exchange (PKCE), written in TypeScript.

publications.name: use-notify-rxjs
publications.summary: Simple, design-free toast notifications using rxjs.

publications.name: url-to-png
publications.summary: Dynamic screenshots for the web over a simple http api.

publications.name: locatizor
publications.summary: Desktop app to add GPS data to jpg's that are missing location (Mac OS/Linux).

publications.name: traverse
publications.summary: Desktop app for explore trending GitHub repos (Mac OS/Linux).
